vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/da429f63-ea46-4876-8372-a3648214e4e4">TRAFFIC</keyword>         <topcClas>Crime and law enforcement - Law, crime and legal systems</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The Metropolitan Police Service (MPS) has commissioned a Public Attitude Survey (PAS) annually since 1983 with the objective of eliciting Londoners' perceptions of policing needs, priorities and experiences across the Metropolitan Police District (MPD). Conducted on a continuous basis, through a programme of face-to face interviews at the homes of respondents, the PAS obtains responses from a random probability sample of residents in each of the 32 boroughs or Basic Operational Command Units (BOCUs) across London policed by the MPS. <br> <br> Prior to the 2002 survey, approximately 4,000 interviews were carried out annually across London, giving a representative sample of residents across the 32 boroughs. Additional 'boost' interviews were carried out with ethnic minority residents to ensure that sufficient interviews were obtained to analyse these groups separately when aggregated across London. This 'snapshot' survey method meant that interviews took place across two months of the year, mainly between September and November. From 2004, the PAS was redesigned in the light of new objectives and from 2011, the number of interviews to be conducted per borough per month was reduced from 160 to 33-34. Therefore, from April 2011 approximately 1,067 interviews per month have been carried out, equating to approximately 100 interviews per Borough per quarter, and 400 interviews per Borough annually.<br> <br> For further information, see documentation and the <a href="http://www.met.police.uk/about/performance/confidence.htm" title="Public Confidence in Policing London">Public Confidence in Policing London</a> webpages.<br> <br> Another MPS survey series, the <i>Metropolitan Police User Satisfaction Surveys</i>, is held at the UK Data Archive under SN 7084.<br> <br> The first edition of the study included data from 2000-2011 (quarters 1-24). For the second edition (June 2013), data and documentation from the 2012-2013 survey (quarters 25-32) were added to the study. For the third edition (January 2014), individual files for 2006-2013 were added to existing holdings (no individual file is available for 2005). The individual files contain date of interview, which is not present in the combined 2005-2012 file. <br> <br> The depositor has provided some advice on analysis by date and the availability of Acorn data: <ul><li>Analysis by date: the variables 'Month' and 'FinancialYear' are not available prior to 2011. The depositor has advised that users who require this information for earlier data years will need to compute it from the 'Date of Interview' variables in the individual year files, where available. Alternatively, the 'Quarter' and 'Quarter1.1' variables may be used for analysis by date in the combined file.</li><li>Acorn data are only available up to March 2011.</li></ul></abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered in the PAS include: local area and community; fear of crime and local crime problems; terrorism; attitudes to policing; victimisation; contact with police; the criminal justice system; communication with the police; general views on the police and the law; demographic details and household information.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="2000-01-01T00:00:00Z">2000</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2013-01-01T00:00:00Z">2013</timePrd>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogCover>Greater London</geogCover>         <geogUnit>Wards (Electoral)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>London Boroughs</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>Subnational</universe>         <universe>Residents in each of the 32 London boroughs.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Alpha/numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>MRUK Research</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>Opinion Research Services Ltd</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>BMG Research </dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>B</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
